description: Smallest difference between consecutive divisors of n.
comments: a(n) = 1 if n is even and a(n) is even if n is odd. A060684 contains just the odd-numbered terms.a(n) = least m>0 such that n!+1+m and n-m are not relatively prime. - _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 21 2012
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
A. Balog, P. Erd≈ës and G. Tenenbaum, On Arithmetic Functions Involving Consecutive Divisors, In: Analytical Number Theory, pp. 77-90, Birkhauser, Basel, 1990.
example: For n=35, divisors={1,5,7,35}; differences={4,2,28}; a(35) = smallest difference = 2.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 19 2001
